body:
KeyedStoreIC::UpdateStoreElement and related dispatch in ic/ic.cc. This code updates the feedback vector for keyed store ICs when a store to array/object occurs, handling monomorphic/polymorphic transitions, computing StoreElementHandler for receiver maps and different KeyedAccessStoreMode values. Key behaviors: selects StoreFastElementBuiltin for fast element maps (fast/typed arrays), chooses ElementsTransitionAndStore stub when an elements-kind transition is possible, encodes validity_cell checks when the prototype chain might change, and makes the IC progress to polymorphic/megamorphic when required. Relevant callsites: KeyedStoreIC::Store uses TryConvertKey/KeyType, GetStoreMode, then calls Runtime::SetObjectProperty and UpdateStoreElement; UpdateStoreElement (ic/ic.cc) configures vector state; StoreElementHandler computes the handler (StoreHandler::StoreFastElementBuiltin / StoreHandler::StoreElementTransition / StoreHandler::StoreSlow). Miss/Slow runtimes are Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Miss and Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Slow in ic/ic.cc. Guard conditions: instance_type checks (JS_ARRAY, JS_PROXY, JS_PRIMITIVE_WRAPPER), elements_kind classifications (fast/typed/dictionary), store modes (kInBounds/kGrowAndHandleCOW/kIgnoreTypedArrayOOB/kHandleCOW), COW handling, prototype validity cell usage via Map::GetOrCreatePrototypeChainValidityCell.

Extracted from: src/ic/ic.cc (functions: KeyedStoreIC::UpdateStoreElement, KeyedStoreIC::StoreElementHandler, KeyedStoreIC::Store, RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Miss), RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Slow), RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_ElementsTransitionAndStoreIC_Miss).
explanation: Central IC logic that maps observed receiver maps and store modes to concrete handler code (builtins or slow runtime). Essential for understanding keyed store fast-path selection, validity cell guarding, and when transitions/misses happen.
file_line: ic/ic.cc : functions KeyedStoreIC::UpdateStoreElement, StoreElementHandler, Store; Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Miss / Runtime_KeyedStoreIC_Slow / Runtime_ElementsTransitionAndStoreIC_Miss (see ic/ic.cc)
